page.title: 16Lifestyles_a housewifes day
page.content: The alarm clock wakes us up at 6.30.My husband has to leave home by 7.00 to be ahead of the traffic build up on Shooters Hill.I call my daughter at 7.30 and drive her to school at 8.50.It is sometimes difficult to cross the jam on Bellegrove Road.I stay in school as a parent helper until lunchtime,guiding the children in the use of the school computer.After lunch I feed our Yorkshire Terrier and take him for a short walk. Housework takes up the afternoon until it is time to collect Diane from school at 3.35.We often do some gardening or put our computer on until teatime.My husband is a self_employed carpet fitter and tea-time depends on his arrival home.We watch T.V._starting with the 6.00 News.We go to bed at 11.00 usually.
